nodes.bodyText: possible endsWith? I'm thinking we might want to catch some classes like FooBuilder or SimpleBuilder?
👍 We might as well catch those :-)
odd that Name has a startsWith, but not endsWith ¯_(ツ)_/¯

requiring it to not implement any methods is probably going to mean we miss any staged builders right? (these would have one class implementing FooStage, BarStage, BazStage which each declare one method?)
That's correct, however staged builders generally use several interfaces with an internal hidden implementation.
might be fine to skip this type return validation? people can always tell us if there are false positives (and suppress as aa workaround :)

Idea is that some (largely legacy) builders are meant to be used via their constructors, I don't want to create a bunch of false positives. This way we only flag builders that we expect aren't supposed to have exposed constructors.
I've updated this to take the builder ClassTree into account given the endsWith matcher.

not 100% sure about the naming conventions we've stuck to, but somehow I feel like flipping this round and naming this after the 'bad' case feels more appropriate to me, so that people could write @SuppressWarnings("badthing") to acknowledge there's something dodgy and they're ignoring it?
Perhaps something like ImplicitPublicBuilderConstructor or UnintentionalPublicBuilder or something?
